availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Bishop Brodess (Boyd County, Kentucky, printer & 1st lieut 14th KY Inf; pvt, commissary sgt, & 2nd lieut 45th KY Mtd Inf USA)

body.p: Boyd County, Kentucky, printer and soldier. Maryland native. Married to Mary Eliza Gibbs. Father of Harry Brodess and Charles Brodess. Publisher of the anti-slavery American Union newspaper in Ashland, Kentucky. Served as a delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from October 23, 1861, to November 17, 1862. Served in in the 45th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, commissary sergeant, and second lieutenant from December 9, 1863, to February 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
